title: A Rusty Car from James Bond Movies Becomes a Million-Pound Treasure
summary: This story is about a special car called an Aston Martin DB5 that was in James Bond movies like Goldfinger. A man named John Williams bought it long ago for £985, but he stopped driving it and left it outside to get rusty. Kids in the neighborhood even played on it, thinking it might have cool gadgets like in the movies. The car was very old and rare, with only 39 like it in the world. John and his wife Susan decided to save money to fix it up at Aston Martin's workshop. It took three years and cost £400,000 to repair, but now the car is worth £1 million. They got offers to sell it, but they chose to keep it because it was unique and special to them.

background_read: This article tells a real-life story about a car that became famous from James Bond movies. James Bond is a make-believe spy who uses exciting cars with special features like ejector seats. The Aston Martin DB5 is a rare and expensive car that many people love because of its connection to these movies. The story shows how something old and broken can be fixed up to become very valuable again, and it teaches about making choices based on personal value instead of just money.
Article_Structure: WHO: John Williams and his wife Susan, who owned the car.
WHAT: An Aston Martin DB5 car was left to rust but restored to be worth £1 million.
WHERE: Mold, Flintshire, and Aston Martin's workshop in Buckinghamshire.
WHY: Because John loved the car since childhood and decided to restore it instead of selling it.

perspectives.description: John and Susan valued the car for personal memories and rarity, choosing to keep it despite high offers.
